ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six ate sticking out their tongues. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not eat sticking out my tongue,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.4_0: One should not eat sticking out one’s tongue.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats sticking out his tongue, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.8_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk49:1.9_0: The ninth training rule is finished.
